full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 209 of 228 885 LC2VMAX6 Alessi - Direct the information conveyed to whoever is operating anything down in this book after 2002; correct? A. That's correct. Q. And I don't believe you've identified any handwriting other than yours and your wife's handwriting in the beginning of this book; is that correct? A. That's correct. Q. And there are a number of pages in this book that don't have dates reflected in the message pad. Do you know that or not? A. Probably. Q. Okay. I'm actually old enough to have used message pad books in the past. And as I recall -- and you tell me if this is any different -- oftentimes there are five, six different message pads being used at any particular point in time. And someone may write a message in one pad, and then may go to another pad. And so there can be conflicting dates in different message pads at the same time. Was that the practice or not at Mr. Epstein's house? MS. COMEY: Objection, your Honor. THE COURT: Grounds. MS. COMEY: Form, your Honor. THE COURT: Overruled. You may answer. Q. Did you understand my question? A. Yes, I did. No, it was only one pad, and it was usually SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012494
